text:
I created a document with the document-id "logout".

Trying to navigate this this document's metadata in the "Site" tab in authoring
causes and exception:

Request [org.apache.cocoon.environment.wrapper.RequestWrapper@1559e15] does not
contain roles: URI: [/lenya-1.2.2-dev/icn/info-authoring/members/logout.html]
Parameter: [lenya.step] = [showscreen] Parameter: [lenya.usecase] = [info-overview]
creator: tschlabach@apache.org
andreas@apache.org
text:
This is due to the configuration of the BypassableAccessController in
cocoon-xconf.xsl:

  <component logger="lenya.ac.accesscontroller.bypassable"
      class="org.apache.lenya.ac.impl.BypassableAccessController"
      role="org.apache.lenya.ac.AccessController/bypassable">
   
<public>.*switch-user|.*logout|.*[.]css|.*[.]jpg|.*[.]gif|.*[.]png|.*[.]rng|.*[.]xsl</public>
  </component>

URLs of the form ".*logout" are not handled by the access controller, therefore
no roles array is attached to the session. Since we have the login/logout
usecases, IMO we can safely remove this pattern.
